node.title: 'Completely unacceptable': Police refer man to iwi panel over footage showing food, drink thrown at homeless people
node.description: Despite enquiries being made, police are yet to identify the victim.
node.content: ["Police have found the person filmed throwing food and drinks at homeless people in Auckland.", "Police have referred an 18-year-old male Te Pae Oranga for the offence of disorderly behaviour likely to cause violence.", "The video went viral at the end of January, showing a person getting out of a car and throwing food at a homeless person sleeping at a bus stop, shocking Kiwis.", "The man has since apologised on social media blaming his actions on being drunk.", "\"The video has attracted a large response on social media and Police would like to reassure the public that the individuals involved have been identified,\" a police spokesperson said.", "\"While the behaviour shown in the video was completely unacceptable, we would like to remind the public that threatening comments towards those people are also unnecessary and should cease.\"", "Despite enquiries being made, police are yet to identify the victim.", "If anyone has information they think might assist Police, they should contact 105 quoting the file number 220122/2740."]
